TopicTitle: What does KSP inspire you to do?

Articles.Content:
I started playing KSP in 0.13, and was immediately fascinated. My first thought then was this is better than a lot of "full" games I've played.

Then I discovered the community. Everyone here and the moderators, who inspired me to look at aspects of hard science and creativity KSP has to offer.

I created a replica of the Thrust SSC (my thread and that account sadly lost in the server crash) I created models, I RP'd a mission to Duna as if it were actually Mars. Then I recreated the trailer of Sunshine in KSP. I decided to upload it to YouTube, and thought nothing of it, just a bit of fun. Last week I had a similar idea about the AC:Unity trailer which wound up as The Daily Kerbal featured video and has just hit 10,000 views. It also had wonderful comments and insightful criticism. I am awed.

Thank you KSP community.

Thank you if you watched it, and thank you if you helped me when I was a noob and couldn't land on the Mun.

More than that, think about how easy Squad has made it is to create things in this solar system sized sandbox. Create something, Screenshot, video, livestream that idea. There's probably a mod that allows you to do [insert bits you need for your idea here.]

Then go watch someone else's creation because it will probably be a 180 degree flip on anything you create.

Here's a short list excluding the really popular ones; Goosexi,

, CoolJWR, ChickenKeeper, That1Guy, Felsmak,

These people create and comment on each other's content, and I bet they're part of this forum too they've probably helped you out once or twice.

That is what KSP inspires and hell, when Scott Manley commented on my last video I felt slightly starstruck.

Thank you for creating content that inspires me and thank you for enjoying content I create.

For Those with a short attention span;

What does KSP inspire you to do?
